definition: goose feather snow (idiom)/big heavy snow fall

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean

sentences.english: School lin the afternoon, the snow is next, and turned to snow.
sentences.chinese: 下午放学了，雪还在下，而且变成了鹅毛大雪。

sentences.english: Snow is falling in large flakes.
sentences.chinese: 天开始下起了鹅毛大雪。

sentences.english: It began to snow big, far flakes.
sentences.chinese: 鹅毛大雪开始纷纷飘落。

sentences.english: Snow goose feather the field to "wash" of again, like Caesar, like the fertilizer.
sentences.chinese: 鹅毛大雪把田野给“洗”了一遍，就像撒了化肥一样。

sentences.english: Is a beginning to meet Li Li the goose hair that night heavy snow?
sentences.chinese: 是初遇莉莉那晚的鹅毛大雪么？

sentences.english: The snow sheeted down last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里下起了鹅毛大雪。

definition: Daxue or Great Snow, 21st of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st December
snow/snowfall/CL:場|场[chang2]/to have the appearance of snow/to wipe away, off or out/to clean
(of mist, snow, floodwater etc) a vast expanse of whiteness
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
brilliant white snow cover (esp. of distant peaks)
(of snow etc) to fill the sky
